entry.title: Re: Purchase SA for Advance intercompany STO
entry.content:
Hi @Angelasapphire 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you are right. As of the current public cloud edition, the STO process does not support purchase scheduling agreements.

What is supported as of today is the Advanced Intercompany STO, which covers Sales/Purchasing orgs in different companies with Purchase Orders but not scheduling agreements.

Although purchase scheduling agreements are available in public cloud for standard procurement, the same functionality is not yet integrated into the Advanced Intercompany STO process.

At this time SAP is yet to publish any roadmap item or feature note that confirms when or whether this integration will be delivered in future releases.

You may consider raising this on the SAP influence page if this is critical to your busines/project.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Document type SU and tax codes do not correspond to s...
entry.content:
Hello @Andrea_Gr 

This error happens during Italy VAT register consistency check when clearing an invoice that updates a VAT register. The document type SU isn't linked to any register or is linked to a different one than the invoice’s tax code. The process blocks this.

What is possible in S4 Public Cloud

For Automatic Clearing, choose a clearing or payment document type linked to the same VAT register as the invoice’s tax code, such as standard AR and AP payments. In Italy's CBC Configuration, mark SU as non-VAT relevant for pure clearing or assign it to the matching VAT register.

Useful SAP Documentation

  • KBA 3377245 – Document type is not relevant for any VAT registers (Italy)
  • SAP Help Italy – VAT Registers: assign document types and tax codes to VAT registers (explains the same-register requirement)

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Procurement via Service Order initiated by Solution O...
entry.content:
Hi @Sorosch_Sakhiza 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manage Solution Orders, Service Contract Management & Expanded Use of NORM Item Category for Sales Items for more details.

In summary, be aware that when spare parts are added to a solution order that already includes a service contract, the system creates a service order to handle procurement and service execution.

After the service entry sheet is posted, what happens next depend on your configuration:

  • If the service order item is billable, a billing document request is created and invoiced through solution order billing control.
  • If it is non-billable, no billing document will be created. That means your costs will remain internal.

You do have the option to control this behaviour through the item category setup in your solution order template.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Billing document API, Service name: BillingDocument -...
entry.content:
Good day @sai_sandeep 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Operations for Billing Document, REST APIs Documentation & 4E9-New Project Billing Configuration and Process for some details.

In summary, the error you mentioned when you call API_BILLINGDOCUMENT means that you are trying to bill a project billing request. However, this API only supports SD-based BDRs (sales/delivery), not those created by project billing in professional services.

For you to bill PBRQs, you ought to use the project billing APIs or the create billing documents-project billing app instead.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: invocing Date Updation in Sales Order - Billing Docum...
entry.content:
Hello @GAK1 

You do not perform a mass update of the Invoicing Date on the sales order itself, apart from items that use a billing plan. In Public Cloud, you set the date when you create the billing.

KBA 2892513 – How to set the billing date equal to the billing creation date via copy control. This document provides the specific BAdI and custom routine method, along with configuration steps, to set the invoicing date for the billing creation date. SAP Support-2892513 - How to set billing date equal to billing creation date via copy control - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP Help: Create Billing Documents (App F0798), the Fiori app documentation, which shows how SAP Help: Generate Billing Documents (App F0798) works. SAP Help Portal-Create Billing Documents

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Workzone Advanced - My Workspace template
entry.content:
Hi @wkpk! Hope you are keeping well.

According to About My Workspace | SAP Help Portal "My Workspace" is a personal workspace. If the feature is enabled, all users see the same default My Workspace and can modify it to suit their personal requirements with all enabled cards and widgets in the system.

All users can create their own workspace. However, there are some limitations as to what you can use it for and what you can add to it.

  • Only you can see your My Workspace. You can't share it with others or add members to it.

  • You can add documents, apps, and information that you use on a daily basis but you can't share the content with your colleagues or teams using feeds.

  • Some widgets can't be added to My Workspace - for example, Forums or Events.

    This is also reinforced in KBA 3666301 - Is it possible to change the My Workspace default image for all users at once in SAP Build Work Zone Advanced? - SAP for Me which outlines that system currently does not support setting a custom default image for My Workspace at the global or administrative level.
    Users can manually update or replace this image after accessing their workspace, but administrators cannot predefine or push a different image to all users through configuration, theme management, or the Administration Console.

    Should you wish to see this behavior changed, please provide feedback to the Product Management team via the Influence Page where other customers will also have the opportunity to support your functionality request. Please raise an Enhancement request.

    To submit enhancement requests for Work Zone, you can follow the steps below:

    1. Go to the SAP Customer Influence site, log on with your S-user and accept the terms of use.
    2. Depending on which Work Zone edition you use, navigate to:
       SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone Influence Opportunity Homepage
       SAP Build Work Zone Influence Opportunity Homepage
    3. Open "All Requests" and search if your idea has already been submitted by another customer. If not, use the "Submit Improvement" button to create a new idea and fill in the relevant template.
    4. Take the opportunity to vote for ideas that you wish to support and plan to take advantage of in your organization. You will be notified on updates regarding ideas you have voted for.

    Note: On the Customer Influence Homepage, you will find information on how to submit and manage improvement requests.

entry.title: Re: How to fix if IBAN appears in Altern. Bank Acc. in in...
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Bank Statement Processing, J58 Accounting and Financial close & App Extensibility: Manage Bank Accounts for some details.

To summarise, yes may get that error about the IBAN for the account not fitting on Altern when you process an MT940 file in Incoming Payment Files. That occurs because the system matches the IBAN in the bank statement to IBAN field in the house bank master. If it is stored in the Alternate Account field instead, the system cannot recognise it. You can fix this as follows:

  • Go to Manage Bank Accounts --> Open your House Bank Account

  • Then remove the IBAN from the Alternate Bank Account No. Field.
  • Ensure the correct IBAN is only in the IBAN field.
  • Save and reimport the MT940 file.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: A Developer’s Guide to Building Hybrid Transactional Fiori Apps with RAP and Analytical features
entry.content:
In many SAP S/4HANA implementations, particularly those involving Fiori List Reports, business users often require a unified experience that combines transactional capabilities ,such as executing actions on records ,with analytical insights like grouping, subtotals, and totals. This is especially relevant in operational reporting scenarios where decisions are made directly from the data view.
These hybrid use cases are common in operational reporting, where users need to analyze data and take immediate action within the same interface.However, when using analytical CDS views (annotated with @analytics.query: true), SAP RAP imposes architectural constraints that prevent the direct definition of actions within the same view. This limitation can be a bottleneck when designing intelligent, user-centric applications.

To overcome this challenge, the following approach is recommended:

  • Separate OData Services for Analytics and Transactions

    • Analytical Service: Built using a CDS view with @analytics.query: true, enabling features like grouping, subtotals, and totals.
    • Transactional Service: Developed using RAP with behavior definitions to support actions, determinations, and validations. This view excludes analytical annotations to maintain RAP compatibility.

  • UI5 Extension Logic for Action Integration

    • Use SAPUI5 extensions to wire up action buttons in the Fiori List Report.
    • These buttons trigger transactional logic from the RAP-based service, even though the data is displayed via the analytical service.

  • Workaround for Filtering on Aggregated Fields

    • Since analytical views often aggregate fields (e.g., total amounts), filtering directly on these fields may not work as expected.
    • Introduce dummy fields or helper logic to enable meaningful filtering in the UI.

This approach allows developers to deliver intelligent Fiori applications that combine the best of both worlds: real-time analytical insights and direct transactional capabilities. It supports business scenarios such as:

  • Mass approvals with KPI-based filtering
  • Sales performance analysis with direct follow-up actions
  • Inventory grouping with replenishment triggers

By decoupling analytics and actions at the service level and integrating them at the UI layer, you can build scalable, maintainable, and user-friendly applications that align with SAP’s clean core principles.

  • Analytical CDS View (OData V2 or V4)

You’ve correctly defined analytical views such as:

  • Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL: Aggregates planned costs using sum(bpja.wtjhr)
  • Z_I_APPRREQ_COSTS: Joins totals with individual cost records
  • Z_I_APPROPRIATEREQUEST: Combines investment request data with ledger and object info
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Ledger Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Z_I_APPRREQ_LEDGER as select from tka01
inner join tbp0l on tbp0l.waers = tka01.waers
and tbp0l.periv = tka01.lmona
{

key tka01.kokrs as Kokrs,
tbp0l.periv as Periv,
tbp0l.waers as Waers,
tbp0l.lednr as Lednr

}
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Costs Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Z_I_APPRREQ_COSTS
as select from bpja
inner join Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL on Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.Ledger = bpja.lednr
and Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.ObjectNumber = bpja.objnr

{


key bpja.lednr as Ledger,
key bpja.objnr as ObjectNumber,
key bpja.gjahr as FiscalYear,
// @semantics.currencycode
bpja.twaer as Currency,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'Currency'
bpja.wtjhr as PlancostsYear,
Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.Currency as Currency_Code,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'Currency_Code'
Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.PlancostsYear as PlancostsTotal
}

where
bpja.wrttp = '40';
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Costs Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL as select from bpja

{

key bpja.lednr as Ledger,
key bpja.objnr as ObjectNumber,

bpja.twaer as Currency ,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'Currency'
sum(bpja.wtjhr) as PlancostsYear

}
where bpja.wrttp = '40'
group by lednr,objnr,bpja.twaer;
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'IMAK Details'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
@Analytics.dataCategory: #CUBE
define view entity Z_I_APPROPRIATEREQUEST
as select from imak
association [0..1] to imakpi on imakpi.posnr = imak.posnr
association [0..1] to imakt on imakt.posnr = imak.posnr
association [0..1] to imav on imav.posnr = imak.posnr
association [0..1] to Z_I_APPRREQ_LEDGER on Z_I_APPRREQ_LEDGER.Kokrs = imak.vkokrs
{
key
cast(imak.posnr as abap.char( 12 )) as Appr_Request,
imak.abukrs as CompanyCode,
imak.gjahr as FiscalYear,
imakpi.izwek as Izwek,
imakt.txt50 as Txt50,
imav.objnr as ObjectNumber,
Z_I_APPRREQ_LEDGER.Lednr as Ledger,
concat('IQ',imak.posnr) as IQOBJNR,

erdat as Erdat

}

 Consumption CDS View

  • This consumption view is designed to support a Fiori List Report that displays investment request data with:

    • Aggregated planned costs per fiscal year and overall
    • Currency semantics for proper formatting
    • Additional Filters for amounts as the original ones does not support in analytical views.

Once done create a Service Behaviour and Definition for the above CDS Entity .

  • CDS entity with Action Service
    RAP-Based CDS View with Behavior Definition with Action
managed implementation in class zbp_appr_appremail unique;
strict ( 1 );

define behavior for ZAPPR_APPREMAIL //alias <alias_name>
persistent table ZAPPR_APPREMAIL
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
action Email parameter Z_APPROVER3 result [1] $self;
}

Abstract entity for the comments

@EndUserText.label: 'Approval 3 Input Details'
define abstract entity Z_APPROVER3
// with parameters parameter_name : parameter_type
{
comments : char255;

}

Behavior Definition code:

CLASS lhc_zappr_appremail DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zappr_appremail RESULT result.
    METHODS email FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION zappr_appremail~email RESULT result.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_zappr_appremail IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD email.
 READ ENTITIES OF zappr_appremail IN LOCAL MODE
  ENTITY zappr_appremail
    FIELDS ( appr_request )
  WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
  RESULT DATA(lt_app_data).
    DATA: lv_recipient TYPE adr6-smtp_addr.
    DATA: lv_subject TYPE string.
    DATA: lv_content TYPE string.
    DATA : email_template_name TYPE smtg_tmpl_id VALUE 'ZEMAIL_APPROVAL'.
    DATA(email_api) =
  cl_smtg_email_api=>get_instance(
          iv_template_id = email_template_name  ).
    DATA(lv_html_text) = VALUE string( ).

    DATA(i_cds_key) = VALUE if_smtg_email_template=>ty_gt_data_key( ).
  " Get the RawHTML Content and Replace the palceholder with the INV Details in the email
    email_api->render( EXPORTING
                                iv_language = sy-langu
                                  it_data_key =  i_cds_key
                              IMPORTING
                                ev_subject = DATA(lv_subject_tmp)
                                ev_body_html = DATA(lv_body_html) ).

    LOOP AT keys INTO DATA(appdetails) .
   lv_content = |{ appdetails-%param-comments }|.
    exit.
  endloop.

REPLACE 'ZCOMMENTS' WITH lv_content INTO lv_body_html.
lv_subject = lv_subject_tmp.
 DATA(lv_body_html_soli) = cl_bcs_convert=>string_to_soli( lv_body_html ).  " Build HTML for Sending
    DATA(lo_multipart_ref) = NEW cl_gbt_multirelated_service( ).
    lo_multipart_ref->set_main_html(
        EXPORTING
          content     = lv_body_html_soli
          description = '' ).


TRY.

DATA(o_document) = cl_document_bcs=>create_document( i_type    = 'HTM'
 i_text    = lv_body_html_soli
 i_subject = CONV so_obj_des( lv_subject ) ).
* Sendrequest erzeugen
        DATA(o_send_request) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).
* Email-Subject festlegen, ip_subject ist vom Typ String
        o_send_request->set_message_subject( ip_subject = lv_subject ).
* Die Mail an den Sendrequest hängen
        o_send_request->set_document( o_document ).
        o_send_request->set_sender( o_sender ).
        DATA o_recipient TYPE REF TO cl_cam_address_bcs .
        LOOP AT recipients ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_email_recipient>).
          o_send_request->add_recipient( i_recipient  = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( <fs_email_recipient>-email ) i_express = abap_true ).
        ENDLOOP.
* Sofort senden
        o_send_request->set_send_immediately( abap_true ).
* Dokument senden
        IF o_send_request->send( i_with_error_screen = abap_true ) = abap_true.
        ELSE.
        ENDIF.
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(e_text).
    ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

Now genrate the Service definition and service 

Create the Fiori List Report App

In SAP Business Application Studio:

    • Create a new project from template 
    • Select List Report Object Page  with analytical table and select the Odata entity generated from the aggregated Service
    • In the Manifest.json add additional Odata Service or use guided development  

 

 

 

 

 

 

Using the guided development  add a action as shwon below .

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns:core='sap.ui.core'
    xmlns='sap.m'>

 <Dialog class="sapUiSizeCompact"
        xmlns="sap.m"
        xmlns:ca="sap.ca.ui"
        xmlns:layout="sap.ui.layout"
        xmlns:form="sap.ui.layout.form"
        xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
        xmlns:unified="sap.ui.unified" title="{i18n>remarks}" contentWidth="200px" id="idremarks">
        <content >
            <form:SimpleForm columnsL="1" columnsM="1" maxContainerCols="1" layout="ResponsiveGridLayout" id="formexlstat" editable="true">
                <form:content >
                    <Label id="remarkslabel" text="{i18n>remarks}"/>
                    <Input id="idremarksinput" type="Text"/>
                </form:content>
            </form:SimpleForm>
        </content>
        <beginButton >
            <Button text="{i18n>idEmail}" press="._onSend" id="idEmail"/>
        </beginButton>
        <endButton>
            <Button text="{i18n>Cancel}" press="._onCancel" id="idcancelbtn"/>
        </endButton>
    </Dialog>
</core:FragmentDefinition>

Handle the action using the below controller code

sap.ui.define([
    "sap/m/MessageToast"
], function(MessageToast) {
    'use strict';
    return {
        onInit: function(){
           this.loadDialogFragment();
            this.AnalyticalTable = this.getView().byId('apprsendemail::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::apprListEmail--analyticalTable') 
            //this.getView(this.getView().getContent()[0].getContent().getItems()[0].getId())
        },
            _onCancel: function(oEvent){
        
            var oModel = this.getView().getModel();
            this._oDialog.close();
            if (this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog.destroy();
                this._oDialog = null; // Important to nullify the reference
            }
          
          
               
        },
        _onSend: function (oEvent) {
            //var oInput = this.byId("inputParam");
           // var sValue = oInput.getValue();
        
            // Get selected items from the Analytical List Table
            var oTable = this.getView().byId("apprsendemail::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::apprListEmail--analyticalTable"); // Replace with your table ID
            var aSelectedIndices = oTable._getSelectionPlugin().getSelectedIndices();
            var aSelectedItems = [];
        
            aSelectedIndices.forEach(function (iIndex) {
                var oContext = oTable.getContextByIndex(iIndex);
                aSelectedItems.push(oContext.getObject());
            });
        
            // Call the backend action with the selected items and parameter
            this._callBackendAction(aSelectedItems);
            oTable.getModel().refresh(true);
            // Close the dialog
            this._oDialog.close();
            if (this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog.destroy();
                this._oDialog = null; // Important to nullify the reference
            }
        },
        sendEmailList: function(oEvent) {
 //            MessageToast.show("Custom handler invoked.");
            if (!this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog = sap.ui.xmlfragment("apprsendemail.ext.fragment.EmailListDialog", this);
                this.getView().addDependent(this._oDialog);
            }
            this._oDialog.open();
        },
        loadDialogFragment: function(){
            if (!this.ReleaseListDialog) {
                this.oDialog = this.loadFragment({
                    name: "apprsendemail.ext.fragment.EmailListDialog",
                    controller: this
                });
            }
        },
        _callBackendAction:  async function (aSelectedItems) {
            var oModel = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("emailAction");

            var sPath = "/Email"; // Adjust the path as needed
            var mParameters = {
                batchGroupId: "myChangeset",
                changeSetId: "myChangeset"
            };
           
            var comments =     sap.ui.getCore().byId("idremarksinput").getValue();
            // Example of calling the backend for each selected item
            aSelectedItems.forEach(function (oItem) {
                oModel.callFunction(sPath, {
                    method: "POST",
                    mParameters: mParameters,
                    urlParameters: {
                        "Appr_Request": oItem.Appr_Request,
                        "comments" : comments,
                    },
                  
                });
            });
            //Submitting the function import batch call
oModel.submitChanges({
	batchGroupId: "myChangeset", //Same as the batch group id used previously

    success: function (oData) {
  
//      var  oTable = this.getView().byId("releaseapprreq::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::appropriatelist--analyticalTable");
 //       oTable._getSelectionPlugin().getModel().refresh(true);
        // Handle success
        MessageToast.show("E-Mail erfolgreich gesendet");
    }.bind(this),
    error: function (oError) {
        // Handle error
        MessageToast.show("E-Mail wurde nicht erfolgreich gesendet");
    }

});
        },
        
    };
});

Once done deploy the app and this will be available in the Workzone and you see the app showing totals and also actions as shown below :

The approach outlined in this guide demonstrates how to:

  • Leverage CDS view annotations for grouping, subtotals, and totals
  • Integrate status tracking and multilingual support
  • Enable transactional actions like sending approval emails via RAP behavior
  • Maintain a clean architecture by decoupling analytics and actions at the service level and integrating them at the UI layer

This design not only enhances user productivity but also aligns with SAP’s clean core principles, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and future readiness of your S/4HANA applications.

entry.title: Re: Error message F110 : payment not possible because of...
entry.content:
Hello @oumouKD 

Your log only displays the generic F110 stop; the real blocker remains hidden until you enable the detailed proposal log.

Perform this task in Public Cloud with Fiori Manage set to Automatic Payments:

  • Open your run, then go to Parameters, and check the boxes for Line items, Payment method selection, and Due date and cash discount.
  • Re-run the Proposal, then open it to review Exceptions and Items to identify item-level errors such as Payment method not permitted, No house bank found, Partner bank type required, or Payment block.

Fix according to the message:

  • Payment method in company code (App Manage Payment Methods in Company Code),
  • Bank determination/house bank in the run,
  • Vendor bank/partner bank type/IBAN, or Remove payment block / ensure item is due.

Useful SAP documentation

SAP KBA 2858351 - How to check logs in the App Manage Automatic Payments

SAP Help – How to analyse payment proposal errors in F110 (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).

In S4 Public Cloud, you must use the Manage Automatic Payments (F110) Fiori app and its Detailed Log / Exception views (not SE38). The general steps in the guide, checking parameters, and viewing logs, remain conceptually valid, but the navigation and tools differ in the Public Cloud

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Date Determination in Finance, Creating Custom CDS Views & Custom CDS Views for more insights.

In summary, there is currently no standard report for CDS view that shows the Tax Date or Tax Rate directly when you make use of the Tax Determination by Tax Date in public cloud. You can workaround this by:

  • Building a Custom CDS View on I_TaxJournalEntryItemCube or I_JournalEntryItemCube and include the Tax date field.
  • Make use of a Custom Field & Logic enhancement to store the Tax Date during your posting.
  • In regard to legal reporting, ensure to check if your DRC reports already show the applicable rate.

Hello @Amit66 

There is no standard switch to prevent users from entering the same manual item condition ZPR1 multiple times, which causes the pricing to be summed up.

To enforce only once per item, either to avoid a manual base price and set ZPR1 to automatic in Manage Prices Sales or add a BAdI check to reject a second ZPR1 item.

Helpful SAP Documentation

SAP Help , Pricing and Conditions: behaviour of conditions in pricing. SAP Help Portal-Pricing and Conditions

KBA 2756560 , Cloud BAdIs for pricing include the Public-Cloud pricing BAdIs that help you enforce the single-entry rule by checking and overriding item conditions. This ensures smooth and consistent pricing management. 2756560 - Cloud BAdIs for pricing

Let me know if you need more support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Maintenance Order Not Showing in Capacity Scheduling...
entry.content:
Good day @MohamedKharbouch 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Maintenance Scheduling Board, Capacity Scheduling Board & Capacity Requirement

This is one of the most discussed integration topics between plant maintenance and production planning in public cloud. Fact is, both are handled by separate capacity evaluation applications and distinct capacity categories.

To answer you question:

Answer to Question 1: No, it should not. Maintenance order will appear in the Maintenance Schedule Board.

Answer to Question 2: eliminated by answer 1.

Answer to Question 3: Yes, the functionality is not available in public cloud.

The summary is, in public cloud, the maintenance orders do not appear in the production Capacity Scheduling Board. Even if both share the same work center, PM uses a different capacity category, and PP boards evaluate only the production capacities.

Integration with the production load is not available in public cloud. This you will only find in on-prem/private cloud.

If you want to coordinate maintenance and production downtime, make sure to use the Maintenance Scheduling Board or shift-availability planning in PP.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Pack stock (not received) in to HU for Inbound Delivery
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Operations for Handling Unit API & Pack Outbound Deliveries for more details.

In summary, you cannot pack inbound delivery items into handling units through API before good receipt. The handling Unit API requires StockItemUUID, which only exists after good receipt. However, you can consider the following options to enable you carry out the intended action:

  • Make use of Pack Inbound Deliveries manually before GR
  • Or post GR first, then call the API_HANDLING_UNIT_2 with StockItemUUID.

Please note that reference-based HU creation works only for outbound deliveries.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to exclude BankDetails segment from Business P...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Bank Details (BUT0BK) segment of the Business Partner SOAP message SAP_COM_0008 BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest) cannot be excluded through standard DRF filtering.

What options are available to you (safe choices)

Intercept BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest and strip the <BankDetails> node before forwarding to EWM to prevent IBAN/BIC from leaving S/4HANA Public cloud.

Avoid storing bank data on suppliers frequently replicated to EWM, as it's often unfeasible in finance scenarios.

Check below KBA

KBA 3012682 — Business Partner Segment Filter is not considered in S/4HANA Public Cloud; segment filters apply at object level, but do not remove entire BP unless filtered. SAP Support Portal-KBA 3012682 - Business Partner Segment Filter not Considered in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

KBA 3245240 — Filters for Business Partner (SAP_COM_0008) SOAP Replication do not take effect, documenting filtering behaviour and limitations for SAP_COM_0008. SAP Support Portal-3245240 - Filters for Business Partner (SAP_COM_0008) SOAP Replication Not Taking Effect

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Clarification on “Manage Memo Record 2.0” and Bank Ac...
entry.content:
Hello @hyik 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manage Memo Records 2.0 for more insights.

In summary, the behaviour you are experiencing when you use Manage Memo Record 2.0, the uploaded amount appears in Cash Flow Analyser but not as the opening balance in your first bank statement is a standard behaviour in public cloud.

Memo records are meant for liquidity forecasting and not for bank reconciliation. The Bank Statement app reads your opening balances only from the statement file or manual entry but not from memo data.

Best practice is to use Manage Memo Records 2.0 for your liquidity planning.

You should include your opening balance directly in the first bank statement upload for reconciliation.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Missing data in SAC Data Analyzer table vs. S/4HANA Report Monitor query result
entry.content:
Hi All ,

I am experiencing a discrepancy between the cost center list displayed in the Data Analyzer table in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Vs what is shown in the Report Monitor in S/4HANA.

Issue Description

  • The Data Analyzer table is connected to a live model created from a standard CDS view in S/4HANA.
  • When the account hierarchy is set to Level 1, the table correctly shows the total number of cost centers. Table has cost center , account & one more dimension in row , 12 months in the column. 
  • However, when I drill down to the lowest hierarchy level for the account, the resulting cost center list is incomplete. For example, SAC table displays only 20 cost centers instead of 50 concenters data. 
  • In contrast, the underlying CDS view in the Report Monitor (S/4HANA) displays the full set of cost centers.

Observations

  • The only notable difference is the presentation: the Report Monitor displays results in flat structure from the hierarchy view in SAC.
  • I have reviewed several SAP notes regarding table limitations. 3563348 - Data Analyzer : No 'Edit Drill Limitation' option in Data analyzer indicate that Data Analyzer does not have a drill limitation. Despite this, I notice that applying less filters, decreases the cost centers list in the SAC table.
  • I understand that minimizing filters is generally advisable for performance, but finance analysts typically prefer exporting a complete dataset to Excel for detailed offline analysis. Loading the full list in a browser for analysis is less practical.

Please help with the following questions. 

  • Why is the cost center list in SAC Data Analyzer incomplete when the drill level is set to the lowest account hierarchy level, despite no indicated drill limitation?
  • Are there specific workarounds or best practices to enable analysts to export the full dataset (similar to what is available in S/4HANA Report Monitor)?
  • Is there additional documentation or SAP notes that address this specific scenario or known limitation?

Thank you in advance for your support and guidance.

Regards,

Krishna.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere News in September
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere News in September

Another month with two nice new release deliveries ✨

Learn more in my short top features video in September 2025 on YouTube 📺

In addition, explore the latest updates in our community news blogs and more.

 

My top features in September

 

Input Parameters in Task Chains and Transformation Flows

You can now define input parameters on the task level of task chains and also for transformation flows. A scheduled transformation flow uses the default value of the input parameter. Input parameters defined in transformation flows can be used in operators within the transformation flow, except for the Python operation in Apache Spark runtime.

A transformation flow executed as part of a task chain receives input parameters from the task chain. This will allow for more flexible usage of task chains and even nested task chains.

➡️  Creating a Transformation Flow

➡️  Creating Input Parameters in Task Chains

 

Email notification in Replication Flows

You can setup email notifications to stay informed when individual replication objects fail in a running replication flow. From both the Replication Flow editor or the Flows monitor, you can setup an email notification for failures of an individual object in a replication flow.

➡️  Configure Email Notification for Replication Flow Failure at Object Level

➡️  Working With Existing Replication Flow Runs

 

Fiscal Time Dimension

When creating a time dimension view, you now have the option for dimension type Standard and Fiscal Time. You use the new Fiscal Time dimension type to model your fiscal time periods and the columns that define their starts and ends. When you add a fiscal time dimension to an analytic model, a Fiscal Variant variable is created for this dimension. The variable can then be handled like any other variable. Its data type is derived from the fiscal variance column from the fiscal time dimension.

➡️  More information

 

Structure Support for Analytic Models

In order to create restrictions and calculations across all measures of an analytic model, you can create structures. Structures help you to save time and ensure consistency in your calculations, as you don’t need to create a formula/calculation for each measure. In the data preview, the structure members are displayed in their own section. When you use a structure member in the drill-down of a preview, the restriction and calculations defined in the structure member will be applied to each measure. Structures can also be used and enhanced in SAP Analytics Cloud. When the analytic model has measures and at least one structure you need to define how the calculations should be prioritized.

➡️  More information

 

 

SAP Business Data Cloud Getting Started Series

 

Starting September 10, the Getting Started Series kicks off with four modules

entry.title: Re: Need to extend F3893 Sales Order Manage V2 fiori App...
entry.content:
To extend the F3893 Sales Order Manage V2 Fiori app to stop the order from saving (simulate order data), you can follow these steps:

1. Use the BAdI for Sales Order Validation:

  • SAP provides a Business Add-In (BAdI) called BADI_SD_SALES_ORDER or BADI_SALES_ORDER for order validation.

  • You can implement this BAdI to simulate order data and prevent the sales order from being saved.

2. Custom Logic for Order Simulation:

  • Implement custom logic in the BAdI to validate the order data (e.g., check if certain conditions are met before saving).

  • To simulate the data and prevent saving, you can use RAISE EXCEPTION or manipulate the status of the order to prevent it from being committed.

3. Enhance the Fiori App:

  • If necessary, extend the Fiori app using the SAP Fiori App Extensibility framework.

  • You may need to create a custom controller or use the SAPUI5 extension for Fiori to add a custom action, like a "Simulate" button, that stops the order from saving.

4. Frontend Logic (Optional):

  • In the Fiori frontend, you can also apply some validation logic through JavaScript or UI5 controllers to prevent the user from clicking the save button under specific conditions.

5. Testing and Debugging:

  • After implementing the logic, test the app thoroughly to ensure that the order behaves as expected (simulated data without saving).

6. Deployment:

  • Once satisfied with the changes, deploy the extended app to your production environment.

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to export all the information within B...
entry.content:
Hello @Luvv_LK 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Bills of Material & Manage Order Bill of Material for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, the Explode BOM app only provides hierarchical view and cannot export full BOM data. To enable you export complete BOM details you should:

  • Use the Manage Bills of Material app for manual single-level export, or
  • You use the API_BILL_OF_MATERIAL_SRV to retrieve full multi-level BOMs.

If you need a combined view, then you should create a Custom CDS View joining both of them.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Missing data in SAC Data Analyzer table Vs S/4HANA Report monitor
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I am experiencing a discrepancy between the cost center data displayed in the Data Analyzer table in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and what is shown in the Report Monitor in S/4HANA.

Issue Description

  • The Data Analyzer table is connected to a live model created from a standard CDS view in S/4HANA. Table has costcenter , account and another dimension in row and 12 months in column. 
  • When the account hierarchy is set to Level 1, SAC table correctly shows the total number of cost centers.
  • However, when I drill down to the lowest account hierarchy level, the resulting cost center list is incomplete.
  • In contrast, the underlying standard CDS view in the Report Monitor (S/4HANA) displays the full set of cost centers

Observations

  • The only notable difference is the presentation: the Report Monitor displays results in flat presentation from the hierarchy view in SAC.
  • I have reviewed several SAP notes regarding table limitations.  As per note, 3563348 - Data Analyzer : No "Edit Drill Limitation" option in Data analyzer, Data Analyzer does not have any drill limitation.
  • Despite this, I notice that applying less filters to the table reduces the list of cost centers in the SAC table. For example, if there are total of 50 costcenters, only 10 costcenters are getting retrieved & displayed if account hierarchy drill level is set to lowest and/or reduce the number of filters.
  • I understand that minimizing filters is generally advisable for performance, but finance analysts typically prefer exporting a complete dataset to Excel for detailed offline analysis. Loading the full list in a browser can introduce delays while scrolling and is less practical.

Could you help clarify the following:

  • Why is the cost center list in SAC Data Analyzer incomplete when the drill level is set to the lowest hierarchy level, despite no indicated drill limitation?
  • Are there specific workarounds or best practices to enable analysts to export the full dataset (similar to what is available in S/4HANA Report Monitor)?
  • Is there additional documentation or SAP notes that address this specific scenario or known limitation?

Thank you in advance for your support and guidance.

Best regards,

Krishna

entry.title: Re: How to prevent automatic apportionment by profit cent...
entry.content:
Hello @SATOSHI_S 

This is a standard document splitting by Profit Center in S/4HANA Cloud. When a voucher has items with multiple Profit Centers (PRCTR) and lines that cannot carry PRCTR like customer/  or vendor recon, some tax/bank lines, the system proportionally distributes those lines across the item PRCTRs to balance the document per profit center. This behaviour can't be switched in Public Cloud.

How can you get  no apportionment outcome?

Via Best practice: Submit one accounting document for each Profit Center. When using the Journal Entry , Post (SOAP) JournalEntryBulkCreateRequest, send a separate JournalEntryCreateRequest for each PC.

For a G/L-only journal, you can retain a single voucher if you explicitly specify the ProfitCenter on each line, including offset and tax lines, calculate tax per PC, and post separate tax lines per PC.

If the document includes customer/vendor reconciliation lines, you cannot assign PRCTR to those lines via the API, as splitting will occur. Therefore, split the posting per PC.

Useful references (Public Cloud)

  • SAP Help-Document Splitting (S/4HANA Cloud) , explains proportional inheritance/splitting by characteristics like Profit Center and why non-assigned lines are distributed.
  • API: Journal Entry – Post (Synchronous)  request structure shows the ProfitCenter field on items and the rule that reconciliation lines do not carry PRCTR; post separate documents to control PC

Let me know if you need more information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Service Interfaces and ABAP Proxy generation support in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
You have to go to your sub-account admin page and you have to create here a service instance of type "SAP Process Integration Runtime" and plan "api".  When creating the instance you get asked for the roles:

{
"grant-types": [
"client_credentials"
],
"redirect-uris": [],
"roles": [
"AuthGroup_IntegrationDeveloper"
],
"token-validity": 3600
}

Then you have to create an key - this you have to configure in your ABAP backend in transaction OA2C_CONFIG.

entry.title: Re: Error During Scheduled Job Execution in BD6 Basic Cre...
entry.content:
Hello @nurulaffzan 

Thank you for your question.

When you run Credit Management Jobs in scope item BD6, you may possibly encounter the error about currency/unit conversion. The reason it happens is because the system tries to convert MYR to USD but cannot find a valid exchange rate for the posting date. Even if your company code and credit control area are in MYR, the system still checks the group currency which is USD at the controlling area level. However, you can consider the following to solve that issue:

  • First, check your Credit Control Area currency to confirm what is defined.
  • Second, Use the Maintain Exchange Rates app to maintain a valid MYR to USD exchange rate.
  • Thereafter, ensure to re-run the job.

Have a look at Maintain Exchange Rates & Import Foreign Exchange Rates for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Where’s Waldo … ah … Terraform?
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Christian Lechner and I’m Product Manager for the BTP CLI as well as for the Terraform activities around SAP BTP.

I love developer experience and want to make their life as well as the life of SAP BTP administrators easier so that they can focus on what really matters when developing business applications and extension.

My Sessions:   

The title of this post already gives a hint. There is no standalone session that deals with Terraform. No need to be sad though, we managed to bring some Terraform magic into the following sessions showcasing that Terraform can help you at various scenarios that might not be obvious at a first glance:

  • XP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP, Wednesday, Nov 511:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET (deep dive)
  • XP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP, Tuesday, Nov 4, 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET (hands-on workshop)
What you will learn about: 

Let’s start with the deep-dive “XP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP”: this session gives more background information on the day 2 tasks when operating cloud native apps.
In this session you will get some insights on what to consider around Terraform focusing on the challenges after you have successfully deployed the infrastructure for your app. Of course, we will also discuss topics like observability and alike as central parts of day 2 operations.
While the session complements the hands-on workshop “XP265 | Master managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime”, the hands-on session is no prerequiste for the deep dive.

The second chance to learn about Terraform is the hands-on workshop “XP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP”. This hands-on workshop puts the spotlight on the FinOps part of SAP BTP and the increasing options SAP BTP offers to deal with this important topic.
A perfect fit for Terraform, right 🤔? Not at a first glance. But here’s the point: provisioning and managing your account structure with Terraform can make your life much easier when it comes to FinOps as you will ensure a consistent account structure including features like labels that support you in mastering the FinOps challenges. That’s why you will learn how to set up your accounts via Terraform and how to enhance the account structure in a consistent way keeping you on the light side of the (FinOps) force.

Co-speakers: 

 I have the honor to share the stage with:

  • Keren Rotenberg (@keren_rotenberg) 
  • Michal Keidar (@michal_keidar) 
  • Stephan Klevenz (@sklevenz) 
  • Yaron Livneh (@Yaron-Livneh) 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

As mentioned before the following hands-on workshops might be of interest when working with cloud-native apps in the Cloud Floundry or Kyma runtime:

  • XP264 | Explore how to run cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Kyma runtime
  • XP265 | Master-managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime
Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

DevOps 

Related community topic pages:   

DevOps 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

No matter if you want to start with Terraform or want to get some deeper insights on what’s up after provisioning your resources with Terraform we got you covered.

Besides the pure learning aspect keep in mind: TechEd was never about learning only but connecting and discussing with peers, so take the chance to learn with and from others on their journey with SAP BTP operations.

Now let’s hear from you: 

What are your experiences with operational tasks on SAP BTP using Terraform or the BTP CLI? Stumbled across some rough edges that you would like to discuss. Ideas how to improve the experience with Terraform or the BTP CLI?

I’d love to hear and learn from you – let’s meet at SAP TechEd 2025 and improve the SAP BTP experience together!

entry.title: Re: Unable to find Communication Management app in SAP S/...
entry.content:
Good day @an_jaehee 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Maintain a Communication Arrangement for Inbound Communication & Getting started with SAP API Business Hub for more insights.

In summary, the confusion about the Communication Management and Communication Arrangement apps is common when working with public cloud trial tenant. The fact is those apps are not available in public cloud. They are only provided in implementation or productive tenants where you are allowed to set up integration.

I recommend you use the SAP API Business Hub Sandbox or SAP BTP trial to test ODATA APIs.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
